> Shard recognized the Predacon reaction immediately - one that 
> mirrored=
 his own with hostility and show of power. They were both 
> similar in hei=
ght and build, Shard only being an inch or two shy of 
> Myrmidon. 
> 
> Fo=
r a few seconds, Shard just glared at him, as if to show that he
> couldn't=
 be intimidated or forced into answering if he didn't want 
> to. "Shard," =
he said. "I awoke from a stasis pod in the forrest and 
> saw the battle. N=
ow that it's over, I want some answers. 
> specifically about what factions=
 are here and who's on whose side."
> He glanced over his shoulder in the d=
irection of the Maximals. "I 
> detect Maximals in the area, but they appea=
red to be fighting on 
> your side."
> 
> As he finished, his glare shifted=
 back to Myrmidon, his tone picking
> up an accusatory edge.

Myrmidon laug=
hed as he crossed his hands over his chest, his stance
defiant and aggressi=
ve, yet strangely not openly combative . . . yet. 

"It is good to a warrio=
r, one not afraid to act." Despite his apparent
humor Myrmidon's optics are=
 intelligent and penetrating as he watched
Shard. 

Myrmidon chuckled, "But=
 there is much you do not know." He gestured at
the seemingly hundreds of f=
allen sweeps, "Your sensors pick up Maximal
and Predicon signatures, but wh=
at of these beings?"

(TAG: Shard)

e normally impervious to

s? I don't know

=
> Hydras opened com link to all his troops and said "Let's go home...
> We =
have done here... Myrmidone, I'm geting a streange signature
> around you..=
. Report about"

Myrmidon opened a communication link with Hydras, "We have=
 a
newcomer." Myrmidon's optics fastened on Shard once again as he
continue=
d to talk into his radio, "His signature is strange, but he
has the feel of=
 a predacon!"

(TAG: Hydras)
-----------------------------

Meanwhile Skorp=
onok, some distance away from Myrmidon and Shard walked
over the fallen for=
ms of Cyclonus, Scourge and Rodimus, a pensive look
on his face. A light ch=
uckle could be heard coming from his vocator as
his face broke into a small=
 smile. 

With a thought Skorponok shifted into his rather large crab mode.=

While he was no longer capable of a mobile city mode, he could still
becom=
e large enough to carry troops. Doors opened on the crab's side
and cranes =
reached out and dragged the three forms inside. With an
ominous click the d=
oors closed, sealing the three inside, and the crab
quickly began to burrow=
 into the ground. 

(TAG: Anyone)
